page.title: 16WHERE WE GO TO SHOP.
page.content: Our local shops are chemists, newsagents and off_licences.If we want a bigger variety we go to the town a kilometre away. Until 1981 however the variety was still not great and many people travelled to Newcastle but since then a lot of development has taken place and a near derelict area, called The Lanes, now attracts people to shop here. Nearly Â£17 million was spent in keeping the character of the old lanes while providing for the requirements of modern shopping.The British Council of Shopping Centres has just voted the centre top in its national survey and the local 'Cumberland News' editorial has suggested that the old title for Carlisle,{Railway City}should now be changed to Shopping City.
